description.text: The Camino Primitivo, or Original Camino is the oldest of the Camino routes to Santiago de Compostella. King Alfosno II of Asturias is considered its first pilgrim in the 9th century.@en

notes.text: The Camino Primitivo involves many steep ascents and descents. Consider dropping your per-day distance target by 2-4km.

title: Camino Primitivo in Lavadoira, Asturias, Spain@en
Camino Primitivo de Santiago en Lavadoira, Asturias, España@es

statements.value: Camino del Norte and Camino Primitivo, Dave Whitson and Laura Perazzoli, Cicerone, 2022

accommodation.name: Valle del Nonaya Hostel and Boarding House

pois.name: Church of St Peter and Museum of Religious Art

notes: The Camino route passes some way South of the actual village.@en

notes.text: If taking the Hospital Route, no groceries are available until Berducedo@en

accommodation.name: Santa Maria de Borres Pilgrims Hostel
Casa Marqués Boarding House, Hostel, Bar

description.text: Large tunnels used by the Romans to take water to the gold mines. Some tunnels run for tens of kilometres.

notes.text: These tunnels are 4km from the main Camino route

pois.name: Vending Machines@en
pois.description: The last source of supplies before Lugo@en

notes.text: Requires a 2.5km walk there and a similar return. Follow the LU-2903 to the temple and the red arrows to return to the main route.

accommodation.name: As Seixas Xunta de Galcia Pilgrims Hostel

Monasterio de Santa María de Valdediós@es

routes.name: Camino Primitivo
routes.description: The main Camino route starting in Oviedo and ending at Stantiago de Compostella and following the Southern route

description.text: Orginally the main route, the Hospital Route is a mountainous track to Berducedo. It passes the ruins of hospitals - pilgrim's inns - from when this was the main route.@en

notes.text: The route is long and there are no services. Ensure you have sufficient food and water.@en

description.text: Burón was the original centre of this region and the original pilgrimage route passed through this location.@en
The original start point of the Primitivo. Start from Villaviciosa on the Camino del Norte and walk up to Oviedo.@en

name: Camino del Norte Connection, High-level Variant@en

description.text: Bypass the Monastery of Santa María la Real de Valdediós and head directly into the hills.@en

route-logic.description: Changes for the Camino del Norte connection
Changes for the Camino del Norte high-level variant
